intro: Phyllanthus antillanus var. hypomalacus, commonly known as the Caribbean spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It is a shrub that typically grows in coastal areas and disturbed soils, exhibiting succulent leaves and yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and unique floral structures. It has a compact growth habit with thick, fleshy leaves that help it retain water in arid conditions. This variant is distinguished by its smaller, more elongated leaves compared to other varieties of Phyllanthus antillanus.
